tossups.question: A work in this genre has a young girl looking at the viewer while firetrucks and a burning house blur into the background. Renaissance paintings have been adapted into this genre, the most popular being the Mona Lisa. “Woman pointing at cat” is a work in this genre while An “ugly cry” featuring a (*) celebrity on Keeping Up With the Kardashians was turned into a work in this genre. Two images of a girl taking a sip of a drink and making a face are paired together and commonly called “Kombucha girl.” This genre includes works with text like “me after attempting” and “my face when.” For ten points, name this genre of works in popular culture which include a picture with a funny caption?

A hypnotic work for this instrument depicts the femininity of Mary as the title O frondens virga. Another word for this instrument by the same composer sees Virtue fight against the Devil for the soul of Anima. Works for this instrument frequently employ the technique of melisma by that composer of (*) Ordo Virtutum. Maddalena Casulana published the first work of music by a woman for this instrument. Barbara Strozzi often wrote motets and madrigals for this instrument while monophonic works for this instrument were written by Hildegard von Bingen. For 10 points each, name this instrument used in Gregorian chants where words are sung in a melodic line.
tossups.answer: voice [accept word forms such as vocals, accept choir]

tossups.question: A black-and-white work of this type titled Untitled (Madonna) is part of a series of 70 works by Cindy Sherman. Sofonisba Anguissola painted many of these types of works, including one showing the title figure painting at an easel. Another work of this type depicts a woman wearing a riding coat, gloves, and a top hat that casts her eyes in shadow, and is an (*) androgynous depiction by Romaine Brooks. Two works of this type by Yayoi Kusama use an optical illusion of polka-dots on a giant pumpkin and contrasting white hair and dark eyes to depict an alter-ego. For 10 points, name this type of work where the artist depicts themselves.
tossups.answer: Self Portrait [Accept portrait until “riding” is mentioned, afterwards prompt on portrait]

tossups.question: A comedic scene in a play by this author features a chaplain shouting, “I will not sit!” and then “I will not stand!” after another character points out that he must stand if it does not want to sit. Later in that work by this author, a character is crowned Charles VII and dreams of (*) Joan of Arc 25 years after her death. In another work by this author, the housekeeper Mrs. Pearce tells the main character to stop swearing after he makes a bet with Pickering. Another character in that play is a flower girl and asks for elocution and etiquette lessons from Professor Henry Higgins. For 10 points, Eliza Doolittle is a character in the play Pygmalion by what irish author?

This thinker wrote about Greek life being divided into two realms of public and private, and in that work, this thinker introduced the terms of vita activa and vita contemplativa. In one work by this thinker, a group’s inability to assimilate into society and their ties to a “nation-state” was instrumental in their persecution. This author of (*) The Human Condition attacked a certain person’s interpretation of Kant’s categorical imperative in one work in which she described that person’s inability to think for himself as an example of the “banality of evil.” For 10 points, what Jewish philosopher wrote Eichmann in Jerusalem and The Origins of Totalitarianism?

Books by this woman detail her life growing up on a cattle farm and a collection of anecdotes called Out of Order. She served as a civilian attorney in Germany and was elected to two terms in her state’s Senate. This woman emphasized the importance of equal protection claims in the case of (*) Shaw v. Reno and wrote the Court’s opinion in the case of Planned Parenthood of Southern Pennsylvania v. Casey, which reaffirmed a woman’s right to an abortion. She was awarded the Presidential Medal of Honor and was replaced by Samuel Alito in 2006. For ten points, which Arizonian woman wrote the book “Lazy B” and was nominated by Ronald Reagan to be the first woman to serve on the Supreme Court?

This leader signed the Treaty of Friendship and Cooperation with the Soviet Union and she founded the “Vanar Sena” when she was 12 years old. This politician presided over three five-year plans, the first of which created irrigation projects like the Hirakud dam and the last of which differed significantly from her slogan of “garibi hatao” or (*) “eradicate poverty.” In 1975, this leader censored the press and instituted mass sterilization camps in “The Emergency.” An attack on the Golden Temple in Operation Blue Star led to her assasination by her Sikh bodyguards. For 10 points, name this daughter of Jawaharlal Nehru, member of the Indian National Congress and first female prime minister of India.

The first major temple for this deity was built at Behbeit el-Hagar by Nectanebo II. This deity took on the form of the goddess of the West, Imentet, when she welcomed souls to the afterlife. This deity’s birthday was celebrated on a day called Amesysia, and in one myth, she (*) poisons a woman’s son after she refused that goddess shelter. In one myth, this deity used a snake made from a god’s saliva to learn the secret name of that god. This goddess took the form of a kite to search for the pieces of a god who had been trapped in a coffin by Set. For 10 points, name this Egyptian goddess of magic, the mother of Horus and wife of Osiris.

One woman with this profession, Frances Spence, worked on a team of six women named for this profession’s key machine. Another member of that team with this profession, Jean Bartik, developed techniques used in this profession such as nesting and (*) subrouting for a machine used in this profession called ENIAC. After a moth was discovered by her associates, Grace Hopper is said to have coined a common term used in this profession. The first woman to have this profession was Ada Lovelace, who developed the first algorithm. For 10 points, name this profession held by people who write instructions for computers to automatically execute in languages such as Python or C++.
tossups.answer: computer programmer [accept computer scientist, accept word forms]

tossups.question: In 2014, this woman started her lifestyle blog titled The Tig, which eventually led to her launch of fashion lines like The 2019 Smart Set and charitable Smart Works capsule. In addition to championing gender equality globally with the UN, this woman has long supported (*) Elephants without Borders, such as by narrating a Disney documentary. This woman’s first major acting role came in 2014 as the paralegal Rachel Zane on the show Suits. For 10 points, name this actress who, after hostile treatment from the press, stepped down from the British royal family in 2020 after her 2018 marriage to Prince Harry.
tossups.answer: Rachel Meghan Markle, Duchess of Sussex  11. This molecule’s abundance is decreased in the absence of nitrogen oxides near volcanic eruptions and PSCs in a mechanism proposed by Susan Solomon. This molecule’s Chappuis absorption band causes a blue hour at dawn and dusk. A spectrophotometer for measuring this molecule, present at Halley Research Station, was invented by Gordon (*) Dobson. Solomon led an expedition to confirm her prediction that free chlorine radicals released from chlorofluorocarbons were catalyzing the breakdown of this molecule in a “hole” over Antarctica. For 10 points, name this molecule that forms an ultraviolet radiation blocking layer in the stratosphere. ANSWER: ozone (or O3)

tossups.question: This molecule’s abundance is decreased in the absence of nitrogen oxides near volcanic eruptions and PSCs in a mechanism proposed by Susan Solomon. This molecule’s Chappuis absorption band causes a blue hour at dawn and dusk. A spectrophotometer for measuring this molecule, present at Halley Research Station, was invented by Gordon (*) Dobson. Solomon led an expedition to confirm her prediction that free chlorine radicals released from chlorofluorocarbons were catalyzing the breakdown of this molecule in a “hole” over Antarctica. For 10 points, name this molecule that forms an ultraviolet radiation blocking layer in the stratosphere.
tossups.answer: Agrippina the Younger [Prompt on Agrippina, do not accept Agrippina the Elder]

tossups.question: This woman was forced to carry around the ashes of Lepidus after she had planned a coup to assassinate the emperor. This woman was killed during Minerva’s five days festival at Baiae, but the original plot to murder her with a boat failed because she could swim. She was given the rights of a Vestal Virgin following the death of (*) Tiberius and was stated to have good fortune by Pliny the Elder. When killed, this woman exclaimed “smite my womb” so her assassins would stab her “in the womb that had born such an unnatural son.” She aimed to place her son on the throne instead of Britannicus and a law was passed for this woman to marry Claudius. For ten points, what woman was the second living woman to receive the title of “Augusta” and was killed by Nero?

This author earned the nickname “Lady of the Chronicles” and kept a diary whose entry on a royal procession corresponds with a fictional one in one of her novel’s chapters, Wisteria Leaves. In that novel by this author, the main character’s half brother loses his vision after having dreams of his dead father, and after learning of an affair, sends the main character to (*) Suma for exile. A character’s death in a work by this author is signified by a blank chapter, and that character is based off the Minister of the Left. That character falls in love with Lady Fujitsubo and has various love affairs in a work by this author. For 10 points, name this Heian Era lady-in-waiting and author of The Tale of Genji.
tossups.answer: Senate Confirmation Hearing of Amy Coney Barret [accept reasonable equivalents that mention Barrett and confirmation]

tossups.question: Sen. Dick Durbin stated that an “Orange Cloud” was hanging over this event, and Pamela Roberts led the evaluation on behalf of the American Bar Association for this event. Laura E. Wolk testified in favor of the main woman of this event citing her teaching at a law school in (*) Indiana, and the main woman of this event stated that she “did not have an agenda” when asked about her rulings on abortion. The main woman of this event was unable to answer when questioned by Dianne Feinstein about the presidential election of 2020, and could not name all of the protections of the First Amendment. For ten points, which event confirmed the replacement of Ruth Bader Ginsburg on the Supreme Court?

The protagonist of this novel reads Lewis Carroll’s “the Walrus and the Carpenter” to Ruthie, who tears up and remarks that she has beautiful teeth. Characters in this novel imitate Wonder Woman and the Beatles, but after the swimmer Aunt Lupe dies, Rachel and Lucy repent for mocking her. This novel’s protagonist lets a boy push her into an open fire hydrant and is sexually assaulted after (*) Sally abandons her at a carnival. That character claims that her name has “too many letters” and decides to change it to Zeze the X. Nenny’s sister yearns to leave a Chicago barrio in, for 10 points, what novel about Esperanza Cordero by Sandra Cisneros?

These people name a tragic poem which states “We are too heavy for our cross / And fall and crush you and your seed” by Elizabeth Barrett Browning about one of these people at Pilgrim’s Point. A poem to the Earl of Dartmouth by one of these people states “What sorrows labour in my parent’s breast?... That from a father seiz’d his (*) babe belov’d” when describing the experience of these people’s families. That author later wrote the “Remember, Christians, Negroes, black as Cain / May be refined, and join th' angelic train.” in a poem titled for a journey these people took. For 10 points, Phillis Wheatley’s On Being Brought from Africa to America contains her experience as what people who were forced to work in captivity?
tossups.answer: menstrual cycle (accept menstruation, accept “period” before read)

tossups.question: During one phase in this process, the stratum functionalis is cut off from the blood supply and necroses, leaving behind the stratum basalis. This process can be inhibited by suppressing the release of gnRH, leading to amenorrhea. Spiral arteries constrict in response to prostaglandins during this process, and the release of hormones such as (*) FSH and LH determines the development of primary oocytes. The lowering of progesterone levels causes painful muscle cramps and the shedding of the uterine lining at the end of this cycle. For 10 points, name this reproductive cycle that repeats on average every 28 days.

A work-in-progress of this type of object, nicknamed its artist’s “final,” is named What is Missing? and highlights biodiversity lost during the sixth mass extinction. Another object of this type is inscribed with the words "until justice rolls down like waters and righteousness like a mighty stream...” and is shaped like an inverted cone with (*) flowing water. “The Forgotten” are 74 names which are not included on that object, located in Montgomery. An object of this type was criticized as a “black gash of shame” and features a sculpture named The Three Soldiers to its right. For 10 points, Chinese-American architect Maya Lin is most famous for designing what type of object to honor Vietnam Veterans?

A novel by this author is interspersed with excerpts from the fictional novel The World Was Silent When We Died, which concludes by revealing Ugwu to be the author. In another novel by this author, the protagonist has boiling water poured on her feet by her father, who is later found dead after being served poisoned tea. This author created a character who refers to her boyfriend (*) Blaine as “Professor Hunk” in her blog Raceteenth, and that novel ends with her saying “Ceiling, come in” to welcome Obinze back into her life. This author talked about discovering Chinua Achebe in her TED Talk “The danger of a single story.” For 10 points, name this Nigerian author of Half of a Yellow Sun and Purple Hibiscus, who wrote about Ifemelu in Americanah.
tossups.answer: World War I [or the First World War or WWI, prompt on The Great War]

tossups.question: In reference to the opportunities for women, Millicent Fawcett declared that this conflict “found women serfs and left them free,” Women who wanted to enlist to fight in this conflict were given a rank with the letter F to denote their gender. TNT caused yellow (*) skin in factories used make supplies for this conflict, and those contaminated were nicknamed “The Canary Girls.” Mobile X ray units were called “little Curies'' and the Women's Battalion of Death was commanded by Maria Bochkareva in the Kerensky Offensive during this conflict. For 10 points, what conflict started the White Flower Campaign and used bilingual women as switchboard operators?

bonuses.leadin: Although the French National Constituent Assembly proclaimed the Declaration of the Rights of Man and of the Citizen, women played an important role in the French Revolution as well. For ten points:
answer: Jacobins (accept Society of the Jacobins or Jacobin Club)
parts: Born Marie Gouze, this woman spoke out against the slave trade in the French colonies but is most famous for her Declaration on the Rights of Women.

Posthumously known as the Angel of Assassination, Charlotte Corday was executed in 1793 for stabbing Jean-Paul Marat [mah-RAH], who was a member of this radical political club that conducted the Reign of Terror.
This woman was convicted of high treason and conspiracy against the State by the Revolutionary Tribunal, though she probably did not actually say “let them eat cake.”

bonuses.leadin: This time period saw the invention of the birth control pill and the legalization of abortion, as well as the normalization of pornography and nudity. For 10 points each:
answer: premarital sex [Accept equivilant descriptions, such as “having sex before marriage,” prompt on sex]
parts: Name this movement from the 1960s to 80s which worked to increase acceptance of the title action. This movement saw the rise of singles culture through the Playboy magazine and the birth of the “career woman.”
A woman who helped publicize the sexual revolution was this anthropologist who wrote Coming of Age in Samoa. That book found that sexual freedom allowed for an easier transition to adulthood.

Derek Freeman disproved Mead’s claims, including that Samoan women used chicken blood to lie about doing this activity. He argued that the Taupau system institutionalized values to stop women from this activity.

bonuses.leadin: This tribe was accused of having a “petticoat government” because women in this tribe were seen as equal to men. For 10 points each, name some things about Native American women who changed history.
parts: Nanye-hi [NAN-yeh-hee] was a woman from the Wolf clan of this tribe who led this tribe to victory in the 1755 Battle of Taliwa in Georgia. “War women” was a title given to women who protected this tribe in battle.

Woman Chief was the third ranked member of this tribe and made peace negotiations in the 1851 Treaty of Fort Laramie. Other warrior women from this Montana tribe were Akkeekaahuush and Biliíche Héeleelash.

This Shoshone woman was integral to the Lewis and Clarke expedition, where she was an interpreter and guide, finding food and easy paths to travel on, as well as preserving supplies on several occasions.

bonuses.leadin: After the capitol riot, Breitbart claimed that this actress “advocate[d] for calling Republicans terrorists” after she tweeted her support for convicting Donald Trump for inciting it. For 10 points:
parts: Name this actress who plays Brooke Davis on “One Tree Hill,” one of the original five core characters. She also voices aspiring superhero Voyd in Incredibles 2.

Bush’s most famous role is detective Erin Lindsay in this franchise named after a city in Illinois. It comprises three title shows, “Fire,” “PD,” and “Med,” and features crossovers with Law and Order: Special Victims Unit.

Bush was one of the 300 women who founded this movement in response to the Harvey Weinstein allegations and the MeToo movement. This movement raises awareness of sexual harassment in the entertainment industry.

bonuses.leadin: Desserts might not be good for you, but they can change history. Name some things about successful and politically charged desserts championed by women. For 10 points each:
parts: This chocolate dessert is named for the military rank of presidential candidate Eduardo Gomes. In the first Brazilian election where women could vote, they popularized it by handing it out at rallies.

Legend has it that when this empire invaded Romania in 1241, the women devised chimney cakes. The hollow bread gave the appearance of plenty of food to fool this empire, led by grandsons of Genghis Khan, into leaving.

This glutinous dessert is prepared in Hishi form for Hinamatsuri, where girls set dolls representing the Heian Emperors on steps. That form of this dessert is diamond shaped and jasmine, mugwort, and water chestnut flavored.

bonuses.leadin: For 10 points each, name some women who won Academy Awards in 2021. For 10 points each:
parts: This woman was the first woman of color to win the Oscar for Best Director. She won the prize for directing the film Nomadland, about Americans who live nomadically in their vehicles for economic reasons.

Dana Murray took home the Oscar for Best Animated Feature Film for this Disney/Pixar movie about a music teacher who needs to reunite the title part of him with his body before he enters the “Great Beyond.”
This artist won Best Original Song for “Fight for You,” which was featured in the movie Judas and the Black Messiah. This artist also performed America the Beautiful at the 55th Super Bowl.

bonuses.leadin: This character’s signature melody opens with a celesta playing G-E-G-F#-D#-E over a harmony of pizzicato strings. For 10 points each:
parts: Name this character in the Nutcracker who rules the Land of Sweets with the Cavalier.
The Sugarplum Fairy’s theme is an example of this musical phrase, which is used to represent a specific person or idea in a work of music, and can be used later on to invoke that thought again.

Another famous Leitmotif which also uses a celesta is by John Williams. It plays at the beginning of Harry Potter films, begins B-E-short G-short F#-long E-B-long A-long F#, and is named for Harry’s owl.

bonuses.leadin: The protagonist of one of this author’s novels is fired from a department store after he puts wind-up monkeys and Barbie Dolls in lewd positions. For 10 points each:
answer: Maxine Hong Kingston (or Maxine Ting Ting Hong)
Hua Mulan or Fa Mu Lan
parts: Name this author who wrote about the aforementioned Wittman Ah Sing in her novel Tripmaster Monkey. Her most famous work is made up of sections such as “White Tigers” and “A Song for a Barbarian Reed Pipe.”

That novel, The Woman Warrior, is a retelling of the story of this Chinese folk heroine, who legendarily took her aging father’s place in the army disguised as a man. Liu Yifei portrayed this woman in a 2020 live-action movie.

Both Tripmaster Monkey and part of The Woman Warrior take place in this city. Diane di Prima became this city’s Poet Laureate in 2009 after having been a part of the Beat Generation in this West Coast city.

bonuses.leadin: One of this artist’s installments includes a room with egg-shaped forms covering the ceilings and walls which slowly turn into breasts near the floor. For ten points each:
answer: Judy Chicago [ accept Judy Cohen, Judy Gerowitz]
parts: Womanhouse, the first installment of femenist art, was created by which artist, who founded the first feminist art program in the US? She also created Birth Project, a work aimed to destigmatize birth in art.

Chicago created this installment in the Brooklyn Museum, which has 39 place settings of famous women on vulva shaped plates. It includes the Heritage Floor, which names 999 women that have made a mark on history.

A companion to The Dinner Party is the International Honor one of these objects, including 539 triangular panels to honor women. These objects include a patchwork of fabric sewn together and can be used as bed covers.

bonuses.leadin: A collection by this author contains a poem beginning with the line “This is the way Aunt Susie tells the story.” For 10 points each:
answer: PTSD or Post Traumatic Stress Disorder [accept Shell-Shock Syndrome]
parts: Name this Laguna Pueblo author of Storyteller who wrote about Tayo in her most famous novel, Ceremony.

Tayo’s memories of his brother Rocky’s death in the Bataan Death March cause him to suffer from this condition. In another novel, Septimus Smith has this condition and kills himself by jumping out of a window.
Septimus Smith appears in Mrs. Dalloway, a novel by this British author who also wrote about the Ramsey family in her novel To The Lighthouse.

bonuses.leadin: Louise Farrenc was the only woman to hold a full chair at the Paris Conservatory. For 10 points each:
parts: Farrenc wrote a Nonet in E flat major that was premiered by Joseph Joachim, a friend of hers and famous player of this instrument. Joachim was famous for playing the Beethoven and Brahms concertos for this instrument.

After Farrenc’s time came this composer, who wrote a difficult Concertino in D Major that is today played by many flautists as standard repertoire. She established a namesake club for others to listen to her music.
Chaminade and Farrenc come from this country. Germaine Tailleferre was the only female member of Le Six, a group of composers from this European country including Francis Poulenc and Arthur Honegger.

bonuses.leadin: A novel by this author ends with the protagonist waving to her family as she sails away to England to attend nursing school. For 10 points each:
parts: Name this Caribbean author who wrote about the title character’s tumultuous relationship with her mother in Annie John. She based her novel Lucy off of her own experiences working as an au pair for a wealthy family.

Kincaid wrote this one paragraph short story structured as a list of instructions. The mother advises her daughter on how to perform household duties so she does not turn into “the slut you are so bent on becoming.”

In Kincaid’s novel Annie John, Annie falls in love with a girl nicknamed this color. This is the color of an “A” that Hester Prynne must wear because of her adultery in a Hawthorne novel named after this color.

bonuses.leadin: This scientist helped develop the technique of radioactive recoil while working in a woodworking shop. For 10 points each:
parts: Name this woman who along with Otto Hahn and Fritz Strassmann developed the theory of nuclear fission, although only Hahn was awarded the resulting Nobel. Element 109 on the periodic table is named in her honor.

Meitner also discovered this effect in which a subatomic particle’s combination with a hole causes the ejection of another particle. This effect is named for a French scientist who independently described it.
The Auger effect occurs when these particles combine with their holes. These negatively-charged particles can also be ejected after a collision with photons in the photoelectric effect.

bonuses.leadin: This character declares “Well I can kill too, because now I have hate!” at the conclusion of the musical that she appears in. For 10 points each:
parts: Name this character, who sings “make of our hands, one hand” during a symbolic marriage scene. Her love interest sings “I just met a girl named [this character]” in a song titled for her.
Maria is the love interest of Tony in this Bernstein/Sondheim musical based on the story of Romeo and Juliet about the rivalry between the Jets and the Sharks.

This character dates Maria’s brother Bernardo and serves as her confidant throughout the play. She sings “Puerto Rico, my heart’s devotion/let it sink back in the ocean” in the musical number “America.”

bonuses.leadin: Most recently, this woman voiced Nala in the Lion King remake and released the documentary Homecoming about her 2018 Coachella performances. For 10 points each:
parts: Name this singer who is best known for hits like “Single Ladies” and “Formation,” off the album Lemonade.
Beyonce released this album in 2003, her debut as a solo artist, which contained hits like “Crazy in Love,” featuring her now husband Jay-Z.
Beyonce first rose to fame as part of this trio along with Kelly Rowland and Michelle Williams. They released hits such as “Bootylicious” and “Say My Name.”

bonuses.leadin: The appearance of large cells on a Tzanck smear can confirm infection by this family of viruses. For 10 points each:
answer: Herpes virus (or Herpesviridae, accept Herpes Simplex Virus or HSV)
lymphoma (accept Hodgkin’s lymphoma or Burkitt lymphoma)
parts: Name this virus family whose “simplex” type primarily causes cold sores in humans. The drug acyclovir tragets viruses in this family.

Alice in Wonderland Syndrome is sometimes caused by this member of the herpesvirus family that can also cause Sjögren syndrome. This doubly-eponymous DNA virus commonly causes infectious mononucleosis.

Epstein-Barr virus has been linked to this type of cancer. A “starry sky” appearance is indicative of this cancer’s Burkitt type, although Epstein-Barr can also cause a type of this cancer named for Thomas Hodgkin.

bonuses.leadin: A hundred years after his death, Emperor Guangxu was revealed to have ingested a fatal dose of arsenic, confirming rumors that this ruler of China had poisoned him. For 10 points:
parts: Name this female regent who engaged in corruption and despotism to consolidate power. She was forced to flee Beijing after she supported the failed Boxer Rebellion.
Empress Dowager Cixi ruled for 47 years during the later part of this last dynasty of China.

Empress Dowager Cixi orchestrated a coup d’etat against Guangxu for supporting this movement led by Kang Youwei. This movement sought to implement broad social reforms, including a constitutional monarchy.

bonuses.leadin: [An-na-EES] has been a popular first name in France since the 1980s. For ten points each:
parts: Rainer Maria Rilke wrote a set of sonnets addressed to this main character of a Greek legend about traveling to the Underworld, which says “And almost a girl it was who emerged / from this joyful unity of song and lyre.”
Mitchell was named after Anaïs Nin, a French-Cuban writer who was notable for publishing works of this type. Another famous work of this type is one written by Anne Frank.
A minor character in this author’s Claudine series is named Anaïs. This mononymous woman is better known as the writer of the novella Gigi, which was adapted into a play starring Audrey Hepburn.

bonuses.leadin: Female nuns who have been fully ordained into this religion are called Bhikkhunī. For 10 points each:
parts: Name this religion founded by Siddhārtha Gautama, whose Mahayana school has historic lineages of female Bhikkhunīs.

This foster mother and aunt of the Buddha was the first Bhikkhunī. In order to become one, she set the tradition of women taking the Eight Garudhammas, which are controversial because they place women as inferior.

This most important sutra in Mahayana Buddhism and foundation of the Tiantai school abolished restrictions on women attaining Nirvana. In Nichiren Buddhism, a woman who follows this sutra surpasses men and women.

bonuses.leadin: This woman’s mathematics education flourished through books on Leonard Euler and correspondence with her mentor Joseph Louis-Lagrange, among others. For 10 points each:
parts: Name this French mathematician who used the pen name Monsieur LeBlanc, the first woman to win the grand prize from the Paris Academy of Sciences in 1816.

Germain won that prize for her work studying the vibrations of plates that had this quality, based off the work of Ernst Chladni. This is the ability of a material to return to its original state after deformation.
If a number and 2 times that number plus one have this property, it is known as a Germain type of this number. These numbers have no factors other than 1 and themselves.
